item.title: Talks to end government shutdown take a promising turn, Senate majority leader says
item.description: Bipartisan talks in the U.S. Senate to end the federal shutdown have taken a positive turn, Senate Majority Leader John Thune said on Saturday.

item.title: Trump tells Senate Republicans to send federal health insurance money 'directly to the people'
item.description: President Trump proposed a new potential compromise on health insurance payments.

item.title: Trump says no U.S. government official will attend the G20 summit in South Africa
item.description: President Donald Trump said the U.S. will not attend the G20 summit in South Africa because of "human rights abuses" taking place in the country.

item.title: Supreme Court pauses order that Trump administration must pay full SNAP benefits
item.description: The Trump administration tried not to pay for any food stamps in November because of the government shutdown. It now proposes partial SNAP benefits.

item.title: SNAP update: Trump admin will pay 50% of food stamp benefits in November amid shutdown
item.description: The agreement to use contingency funds to pay for food stamp benefits came after a judge said Trump administration could not cease paying for the bene...
